pull.title: doc: Fix upper bounds + cleanup in field_5x52_impl.h comment
pull.body: When reviewing #816 I noticed the upper bounds in the comment at the top of `field_5x52_impl.h` were off by 1 (see `fe_verify`). This PR fixes the upper bounds and also cleans up the comment along the way.

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

events.body: Maybe this is a good opportunity to add a similar comment to the 10x26 implementation (or one that refers to the 5x52 comment).

ACK bc7420fcba0c272d23650256e9fea3c12a3abbd3

#816 reminded me that it may be a good idea to document the max magnitudes. (They're checked in the code in `fe_verify` but that's hard to discover if you're not familiar with the code.) But I guess it's not trivial, see https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1028#discussion_r762599882
nit: The comment could also mention the order of the limbs. `[0]` is the least significant limb though that's the natural choice.

ACK bc7420fcba0c272d23650256e9fea3c12a3abbd3
This is great! I spent a lot of time figuring out what are magnitudes and how the field arithmetic works exactly, so any doc improvements there are very welcome :)

events.message: doc: Fix upper bounds + cleanup in field_5x52_impl.h comment
doc: Add comment to top of field_10x26_impl.h

events.body: (I cancelled CI because this is blocking the other builds and the diff here is just in comments.)
